column4: help i installed testdisk but i dont know how to access it. it doesnt appear in System
its a cli command
how do i add it to System?
you won't really,it runs in terminal.You can add it then tell it to run in terminal but you may as welljust run: sudo testdisk
i saw a video where the user goes to system > administration > partition editor but i don't have 'partition editor' in administration
thats gparted
ok now i see gparted partition editor, thanks
np :)
oh gparted partitions editor isnt associated with testdisk?
no, its different
if you only have 30Gb partitioned and 270Gb unpartitioned
but you get the idea
wrong target, sorry
i'm not sure if i have 270 gb unpartitioned or not.  i want to recover data from the '30 GB Filesystem'.  can i just go ahead or is the disk being detected as 30 gb going to pose a problem?
so if the 270 gb turns out to be unpartitioned, then i need to fix it so that it shows up as 300 gb filesystem?
you can partition with parted. sudo fdisk -l   will show what's going on
i'm not sure but i might have partitioned the 30 gb when i accidentally installed ubuntu on it
will this partition be a problem for testdisk
this partition issue, i meant
you only need testdisk if your FAT gets corrupted
as far as i know the FAT isnt corrupted. i just want to recover the files that were lost from the formatting and i thought testdisk might do it
sure, you can also use it with foremost :)
so can i just disregard the fact that it shows up as '30 gb filesystem' and proceed with testdisk?
you can use testdisk to make a 300Gb partition the fsck it
